title: const cycle detected error messages are confusing

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->

```rust
pub const FOO: usize = foo();
pub const fn foo() -> usize { FOO }
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0391]: cycle detected when simplifying constant for the type system `FOO`
 --> src/lib.rs:1:1
  |
1 | pub const FOO: usize = foo();
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
note: ...which requires simplifying constant for the type system `FOO`...
 --> src/lib.rs:1:1
  |
1 | pub const FOO: usize = foo();
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
note: ...which requires const-evaluating + checking `FOO`...
 --> src/lib.rs:1:1
  |
1 | pub const FOO: usize = foo();
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  = note: ...which requires normalizing `FOO`...
  = note: ...which again requires simplifying constant for the type system `FOO`, completing the cycle
  = note: cycle used when running analysis passes on this crate
```

The mention of "simplifying", the "type system" and "normalizing" is confusing.

An alternative proposed by @Kixiron is to just lean into "evaluating", something like:

```
error[E0391]: cycle detected when evaluating constant `main::FOO`
 --> src/main.rs:1:28
  |
1 | pub const FOO: usize = foo();
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
note: ...which is used within function `foo()`
 --> src/main.rs:2:28
  |
2 | pub const fn foo() -> usize { FOO }
  |                               ^^^
note: ...which requires const-evaluating and checking `main::FOO`...
 --> src/main.rs:1:28
  |
1 | pub const FOO: usize = foo();
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  = note: ...which requires evaluating `main::FOO`...
  = note: ...which again requires evaluating constant `main::FOO`, completing the cycle
```
